conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to \( t_2 \), follow these steps:
Object B is represented by the curved line in the graph.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
On a v-t graph, acceleration is the slope of the tangent line to the velocity curve at any given point.
At time 0, the initial slope of the tangent line is steep and negative, indicating a negative acceleration.
As time increases, the slope of the tangent lines becomes less steep and more horizontal, moving towards zero.

premise: The slope of the tangent line to the curve of object B decreases in magnitude over time.
conclusion: This implies that the acceleration of object B decreases as time progresses from 0 to \( t_2 \).

premise: The slope of the graph represents the acceleration.
conclusion: It can be seen that the acceleration of B first decreases and then increases.
